ai.summary: An easy 4.9 km circular walk to Croft Ambrey hill fort in Herefordshire, England. The route follows grassy paths with a gentle climb to the hill fort, delivering wide countryside views and a family-friendly day out for walkers of all ages.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly grass and gravel paths with a few uneven stones and a short climb near the hill fort. The surface can be muddy after rain, so sturdy footwear is advised. Expect gates or stiles and possible livestock along the countryside sections.
ai.safety_notes: Weather can change quickly—check the forecast and dress in layers. Wear sturdy, fitted footwear for uneven grassy and gravel paths. Stay on designated paths to protect the site and livestock; keep dogs under control and on leads where required. Watch for muddy sections and potential drop-offs at the hill fort. Carry water, know your route, and tell someone your plans.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or boots with good grip
Water bottle and a small snack
Sunscreen and hat in sunny months
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (roughly March to October) offer milder weather and longer daylight, though the walk is doable year-round with appropriate gear.
